Dialogue.content: Hi, I'm Maya Chen. It's nice to meet you.
Hello, Maya! It's great to meet you too. How are you feeling today?
I've been feeling a bit overwhelmed lately. I have multiple projects due for my graphic design classes.
That sounds stressful. What kind of projects are you working on?
I'm preparing for an exhibition where I need to showcase my best work, but I'm worried it won't meet my standards.
It's natural to have high expectations, especially for something so important. What specifically makes you feel like you're not meeting those standards?
I keep looking at what my classmates are creating, and I feel like mine won't stand out. My parents also have high hopes, which adds to the pressure.
It's understandable to feel that way. Have you found any ways to cope with this pressure when it arises?
Hi again. I wanted to talk about my anxiety around the upcoming exhibition. It's getting worse.
Hi, Maya! I'm here to help. What's been making your anxiety increase?
As the exhibition date gets closer, I doubt my creative abilities even more. I saw Alice's project, and it's amazing. I feel like I'm falling behind.
Comparison can be really tough. Have you talked with your friends about how you're feeling?
I tried, but I don't think they get it. I feel disconnected and out of place. Even Ella, who's usually supportive, seems busy.
It can be hard when you feel like you're in this alone, but your feelings are valid. Have you considered expressing your emotions through your art? It might be a good way to cope.
Hello, I feel even more lost now. I tried to work late nights on my designs, but I'm just so stuck.
Hi, Maya! It's okay to feel stuck sometimes. What have you been working on?
I've been trying to finalize a piece for the exhibition, but I keep second-guessing everything. I avoided my friends and hobbies too.
That sounds really isolating. How did your brother Leo respond when he noticed you were distressed?
He asked me if I was okay, but I just brushed him off. I feel ashamed that I'm struggling when I should be thriving.
You're not alone in feeling this way. Remember that it's okay to ask for help, even from family. They want to support you.
Hi, I made it to the exhibition, but I felt so anxious the whole time.
Hi, Maya! I'm glad you're here. How did the exhibition go for you overall?
It was overwhelming. While setting up, I wanted to engage with everyone, but my anxiety held me back.
That's understandable. Did you receive any feedback on your work?
Some visitors praised my design, but instead of feeling happy, I brushed it off like they were just being nice.

It's common to downplay praise, especially when you're in a vulnerable state. However, remember that their feedback reflects your talent. Have you thought about how to embrace your creative voice moving forward?
